page.title: 07JOHN LEWIS GAMEKEEPER
page.content: { JOHN LEWIS,Gamekeeper { for the Balcombe estate. { John Lewis has lived in Balcombe all his life.He was a pupil at Balcombe School and then at Warden Park before becoming a gamekeeper at the age of 15.He is married to Joyce and has three children, Stephen 11, Joanne 8 and Gemma 5.All three children attend Balcombe School.Being a gamekeeper is a very busy occupation.A gamekeeper's year begins in February when he catches all the cock and hen pheasants ready for breeding.Also in February and throughout March he shoots and traps vermin, which are foxes,jays, minks,magpies and squirrels.He shoots these animals and birds because they would probably kill the pheasants especially the young ones.
